The much-anticipated film Panjab 95, featuring Diljit Dosanjh, is set for a global release on February 7 without any cuts, although it will not be available in India.

  • The film is directed by Honey Trehan and produced by RSVP Movies.
  • Panjab 95 centers on human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra.
  • The film will explore the human rights violations and disappearances during Punjab's militancy period.
  • It was previously scheduled to premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival but was removed from the line-up.
  • Jaswant Singh Khalra mysteriously disappeared in 1995 while investigating mass cremations in Punjab.

title: NBK, Jr NTR pay tributes to NTR on death anniversary - Greatandhra
summary:
Tributes Paid to N.T. Rama Rao on 28th Death Anniversary

Publication Date: January 18, 2024 Source: Great Andhra

Tollywood actors N. Balakrishna, Jr NTR, and Kalyan Ram paid tributes to former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. T. Rama Rao on his 28th death anniversary at NTR Ghat in Hyderabad.

  • Jr NTR and Kalyan Ram laid wreaths at their grandfather's samadhi.
  • Balakrishna honored his father, recognizing his contributions as a leader and actor.
  • Tributes emphasized NTR's dedication to the welfare of the poor and his political influence.
  • Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh also paid respects, recalling NTR's reforms.
  • Calls for NTR to receive the Bharat Ratna award were noted.
‚ÄúNTR was not only the greatest actor but also dedicated himself to serving people, especially the poor and downtrodden.‚Äù - Balakrishna

The tributes commemorated NTR's lasting legacy in both cinema and politics, highlighting his impact on Telugu self-respect and governance.
newTitle: Tributes Paid to N.T. Rama Rao on 28th Death Anniversary

title: Emergency Box Office Collection Day 1: Kangana Ranaut's Biggest Opener In 5 Years - NDTV Movies
summary:
Emergency Box Office Collection Day 1: Kangana Ranaut's Biggest Opener In 5 Years

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: NDTV

The film Emergency marks Kangana Ranaut's first solo directorial project and has achieved her biggest box-office opening since pre-pandemic times, earning Rs 2.35 crore on its opening day.

  • Opening Day Collection: Rs 2.35 crore, highest among her recent releases.
  • Comparison: Previous solo films opened with Rs 1.25 crore (Tejas) and Rs 1.20 crore (Dhaakad).
  • Occupancy Rates: Overall Hindi occupancy was 19.26%; highest in Chennai (25%) and Mumbai (23.75%).
  • Best Engagement: Night shows had an occupancy of 36.25% compared to morning (5.98%) and afternoon shows (13.95%).
  • Theme: The film is set during India's Emergency period (1975-1977).

‚ÄúEmergency had the highest audience attendance in Chennai, with a 25% occupancy.‚Äù

The opening reflects a significant return for Kangana Ranaut as a director and may indicate renewed audience interest in her work.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut's Emergency Box Office Opens Strong

title: Emergency box office collection day 1: Kangana Ranaut delivers one of the lowest openings of her career after Dhaakad, Tejas - The Indian Express
summary:
Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' Opens to Low Box Office Collection on Day 1

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

'Emergency', featuring Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, opened to disappointing box office numbers, earning approximately Rs 2.4 crore on its first day amid tough competition.

  • The film had around 2500 shows across India.
  • It recorded an overall occupancy of about 19.26% on its first day.
  • Previous low openings for Ranaut include 'Thalaivii' and 'Dhaakad', which earned Rs 1.46 crore and Rs 50 lakh respectively.
  • 'Emergency' is noted as one of the lowest openers of her career.
  • Kangana's last hit was 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' in 2015.
'Emergency' also marks Kangana's solo directorial debut.

This opening indicates a continuing struggle for Kangana in the box office despite her claims of being the highest-grossing female star.
